alert.note: Alert for Howard; Mitchell; Scurry (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Midland-Odessa (Western Texas and Southeastern New Mexico)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued June 02 at 6:37PM CDT until June 02 at 7:30PM CDT by NWS Midland-Odessa
info.description: The National Weather Service in Midland has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Mitchell County in western Texas... Scurry County in western Texas... Southeastern Howard County in western Texas... * Until 730 PM CDT. * At 637 PM CDT, a wall of dust was along a line extending from near Fluvanna to 10 miles northeast of Coahoma to 6 miles northeast of Lomax, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Less than one mile visibility with strong wind in excess of 50 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes Interstate 20 between mile markers 197 and 228. Locations impacted include... Snyder, Colorado City, Loraine, Fluvanna, Colorado City Airport, J B Thomas Reservoir, Lake Colorado City, Lake Colorado City State Park, Inadale, Champion Creek Reservoir, Westbrook, Hermleigh, Randalls Corner, Winston Field, Cuthbert, Knapp, Buford, Dunn and Ira. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
